patterns: History of Campus
History of padmakanya Campus
Tell me history of PK
full form of pkmc
responses: Padma Kanya Multiple Campus (PKMC) was established in 1951(Aswin 2008 B.S.) as first women's campus of Nepal. Initially, its academic activities were brought into operation at the present location of Kanya School, Dillibazar.At the time of establishment, its academic programme started in eight subjects of humanities.The campus then was shifted to nearby Shankardev Campus. Later on, it was transferred to the present location and ever since, the academic activities have been running over here. Presently the campus has been offering higher educational degrees in Humanities and Social Sciences, Management and Science.

patterns: Can I schedule a campus tour?

responses: Yes, you can schedule a campus tour by getting appointment with the person whom you want to meet. The best time to visit campus is 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM, Sunday to Friday.

responses: The Bsc.CSIT program focuses on computer science and information technology, and offers courses such as Advanced Java programming, Web Technology, Artifical Technology, DAA and many more. The Bsc.CSIT program covers programming, technology, Hardware and software knowledge and offers courses such as Advanced Java programming, Web Technology, Artifical Technology, DAA and many more. The Bsc.CSIT program has a curriculum that includes computer science and information technology, and offers courses such as Advanced Java programming, Web Technology, Artifical Technology, DAA and many more.

patterns: what are the requirements for submitting an application?

responses: To submit an application, you will need to provide +2 marksheet, Character Certificate, Migration Certificate, SEE marksheet, Character Certificate and other documents as asked. You may also be required to submit a personal statement or letters of recommendation, depending on the program.

patterns: What career services are available to students?

responses: We offer various career services to students, including guest lectures, IT club, Meet and greet to industry exposure. Our graduates have a high job placement rate, with many finding employment in Education Sector, IT Sector, Health Care, and many more.

patterns: when is the application deadline for the upcoming semester?

responses: The application deadline for the upcoming semester is closed. Unfortunately, we are no longer accepting applications for the fall semester.

patterns: what are the  different Master academics in Padmakanya multiple campus?
what are the different Master Programs in Padmaknya?
responses: There are Master of Arts (MA) in English, Master of Arts (MA) in Nepali , Master of Arts (MA) in Economics,Master of Arts (MA) in Rural Development, Master of Arts (MA) in Political Science, Master of Arts (MA) in Sociology, Master of Arts (MA) in Population Studies, Master of Arts (MA) in Dance, Master of Business Studies (MBS), Master in Information Technology (MIT).

patterns: Do padmakanya multiple campus follow Research Activities Teaching methodology ?
responses: PKMC emphasizes research-based teaching activities and has established a Research Management Cell (RMC) to support both academic research and innovation. The RMC engages students, faculty, and collaborative researchers in generating new knowledge and fostering research-minded scholars for societal, corporate, and political impact.

patterns: Is CSIT entrance exam hard?
Is the CSIT admission exam difficult?
responses: The exam is not as difficult as engineering or medical, so prepare accordingly because you will not be tested on anything other than what you learned in high school. BSCCSIT.COM, the CSIT Association of Nepal, offers several short crash courses for preparation as well as regular mock tests. .

patterns: What is the pass marks for BSC CSIT in Nepal?
What is the eligibility Criteria to Study BSc CSIT in Nepal?
What are the Eligibility Requirements for Studying BSc CSIT in Nepal?
responses: Students must have completed intermediate level/plus two with a minimum of 55% in the Science stream. Math is an optional subject in class 12. Alternatively, students must obtain an A level in Science with a minimum grade of D.

patterns: What is the credit hours for Csit?
What is the credit hours of csit?
responses: Bachelor of Science in the Computer Science and Information Technology (CSIT) is a four-year (eight-semester) degree program affiliated to Tribhuvan University. The program is comprised of computer science, information technology and allied courses of 126 credit hours.

patterns: Is math required for CSIT?
Is biology necesaary for csit?
Is math necessary for CSIT?
responses: Physics and Mathematics must be studied in Grade 11 or Grade 12 or have a D grade in Science with Physics and Mathematics. They must have received at least a second division or C grade in all 11 and 12 results.

patterns: What is the minimal grade requirement for CSIT?
What are the CSIT Eligibility Criteria?
What is the minimum grade to study CSIT?
What is CSIT Eligibility Criteria ?
responses: 10+2 or equivalent qualification in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Each topic received a minimum grade of C. Note: For A Level, pupils must obtain a minimum grade of D in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

patterns: What should we learn at CSIT?
What should we study in CSIT?
responses: It is a combined Information Technology and Computer Science course. We study the design and analysis of software, software development tools, and hardware used to solve problems in a range of corporate settings in B Sc. CSIT.

patterns: What is the CSIT pay?
What is the salary of CSIT?
responses: According to Payscale, the average pay of students with a BSc. Csit in Nepal or a computer science degree in Nepal is around Npr 5,00,000, and the market has boosted the demand for IT workers in Nepal, according to Merojob.

patterns: Is there a negative marking system in the CSIT exam?
Is there negative marking in CSIT exam?
responses: All of the questions will be MCQs (Multiple Choice Questions) or Objective Type. There will be no negative marking.

patterns: Is CSIT a technical program?
Is CSIT an engineering course?
responses: Tech in Computer Science & IT (CSIT) students are taught many parts of computer science and information technology, and the programme is built around the engineering skills that a graduate engineer must have.

patterns: What occupations are available following CSIT?
What are the jobs after CSIT?
What are the scope of Bsc.csit in Nepal?
what is the scope of csit
please tell me about the carreer after bsc. csit
responses: In Nepal, there are numerous and potential career choices after earning a Bachelor's degree in computer science and information technology. After completing the IT course, students can advance their careers as system analysts, web developers, web designers, SEO/SEM analysts, QA analysts, and many other positions.

patterns: How much does CSIT cost?
what is the cost of studying csit?
What is the cost of a BSc CSIT in a Nepal government college?
What is the cost of BSc CSIT in Nepal government college?
responses: CSIT in government colleges ranges between 3 and 4 lakhs. The fee structure for private colleges ranges from 6 lakhs to 15 lakhs. Many colleges are affiliated with foreign universities and charge fees in excess of 15 lakhs.

patterns: What are the BSC CSIT pass marks?
How does the BSc.CSIT GRADING SYSTEM work?
What is the pass marks for BSC CSIT?
What is the BSc.CSIT GRADING SYSTEM?
what is the pass marks of each subject?
responses: The passing marks of each subject is generally 24, but if there's is theory subject like POM, Techical writing than the pass marks is 32. However, in percentage of the Grading System: Second Division 55%, Pass Division 40%, 70% in the first division, Distinction of 80% or higher

patterns: What is the distinction between a BSc in Computer Science and a BSc in Computer Science and Information Technology?
What is the difference between BSc Computer Science and BSc CSIT?
responses: It is a three-year degree that saves you one year of time. those with a science background must apply for BSc. CSIT, whilst those with a non-science background may apply for BSc. (Hons) CS & SE.

patterns: What is the distinction between a software engineer and a BSc in CSIT?
What is the difference between software engineer and BSc CSIT?
responses: Computer science is mainly concerned with the programming and datatype structural parts of computers, whereas computer engineering is concerned with the design and creation of hardware and utilities. Information Technology is essentially the use of what the two majors build to store and map data in databases.

patterns: How many semesters are there in the BSc Csit program?
How many semesters are there in Csit?
responses: There are eight(8) semester in CSIT has been divided into  the first, second, third, and fourth semesters, as well as the fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth semesters.

patterns: How many BSC CSIT seats are there in total in nepal?
How many seats are there in BSC CSIT in nepal?
responses: CSIT program provides seats to only about 2500 students would have the opportunity to pursue their career on this program. To pass the admission examination, the scholar must score at least 40 out of 100.

patterns: Can we enroll in BSc CSIT without taking an admission exam?
Can we join BSc CSIT without entrance exam?
responses: In Nepal, the Institute of Science and Technology of Tribhuvan University administers an entrance exam for computer science and information technology. To engage in B. Sc. CSIT programs at component campuses and private colleges connected with Tribhuvan University of Nepal, an entrance exam is required.

patterns: In Nepal, how long is BSC CSIT?
How many years is BSC CSIT in Nepal?
responses: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Information Technology (B.Sc. CSIT) is a four-year study offered by Tribhuvan University that aims to educate students with a comprehensive understanding of information technology and computing.

patterns: Is there a scholarship available for CSIT?
Is there scholarship for CSIT?
responses: Each college provides a full scholarship to two students. TU identifies two students from each college as full scholarship recipients.

patterns: When does the semester result is published?
When does TU publish Bsc.CSIT semester result?
responses: Bsc.CSIT semester result usually come within 3 months, which is published by TU IOST department of Tribhuvan University

patterns: How many BSc CSIT seats are available in Kathmandu Valley government colleges?
How many seats are allocated in government colleges in Kathmandu Valley for BSc CSIT?
responses: In Kathmandu, Nepal, there are various government and private colleges that provide B.Sc.CSIT courses. The renowned government college in the Kathmandu Valley of Nepal is Amrit Campus (Ascol), Patan Multiple Campus (PMC), Bhaktapur Multiple Campus (BMC), and PadmaKanya Multiple Campus (PKMC). These colleges all issue merit lists for students, and students who are on the list are eligible to attend the college. The following colleges have seats available: Amrit Campus (ASCOL) has 108 seats, Patan Multiple Campus (PMC) also has 108 seats, Bhaktapur Multiple Campus (BMC) also has 108 seats, and PadmaKanya Multiple Campus (PKMC) only has 72 places for ladies only.

patterns: Which is the best college in Kathmandu to study BSc.CSIT?
Which is the best college for studying BSc.CSIT Course in Kathmandu?
What are the best colleges for csit ?
responses: The best college is determined by whether it is public or private. Amrit Science Campus, PadmaKanya Multiple Campus (For girls) and Madan Bhandari Memorial are the top government BSc.SCIT colleges in Nepal, whereas Deerwalk is the greatest private BSc.CSIT college. Similarly, the rates for a government institution are around 2 lakh NRP, whereas Deerwalk charges 12 lakh NRP for four years.

patterns: Can business students pursue a BSc in CSIT?
Can management students study for a BSc in CSIT?
responses: Bsc.CSIT is not only available to students with a science background. The initial batch of Bsc.CSIT students were management students, but because it is a Bachelor of Science, there was a problem because only science students could study BSC.CSIT in Nepal!! If you have a management experience, you can take courses like -BCA -BIM, These courses are comparable to Bsc.CSIT.

patterns: Is CSIT and BCA the same thing?
Is Bsc.csit better than BCA?
responses: BCA is primarily for students with a commerce background who want to pursue a course in the IT field, whereas BSCIT is for students with a science background who want to pursue a more in-depth course.

patterns: How to get admission in Bsc.CSIT?

What is the process to get admission
merit list
responses: Once you obtain the pass marks to pass the BSc.CSIT entrance exam, you need to fill the priority which is provided by TU.IOST, and list your priority campus/college.After that the campus/college publish their merit list, search for your name, and from here campus admission procedure needs to be considered.

Is padmaKanya a governmenet or private campus?
Is Bsc.CSIT in padmakanya is private course
responses: Padmankanya is government campus established in 17th septmeber, 1977 by King Tribhuvan. However, the Bsc.CSIT program is considered as private course in Padmakanya, but Bsc.CSIT are not left out from the campus facilites or considered as private college's students.

patterns: Why to choose padmakanya for BSc.CSIT?
Is PadmanKanya good for CSIT?
Why a girl should pursue to get admission in Bsc.CSIT at padmakanya multiple campus?
responses: Bsc.CSIT at padmankanya multiple campus is providing the best education in the Kathmandu valley, with lessen in fee structure, quality education, better skills, experienced teachers, as well as good infrastruture that a campus should provide to its students.

patterns: What are the available electives for the BSc. CSIT program?
Which elective is more focused in Bsc.CSIT?
responses: choosing an elective subject starts from 5th semester in Bsc.CSIT, the elective depends on the number of students willing to studing a specific elective subject. However, most students choose multimedia and image processing in 5th, e-commerce in 6th, Database Adminstration and Software project management in 7th, and Geographical Information system in 8th semester.

patterns: Are there any specific computer or software requirements for the BSc. CSIT program?
responses: Yes, there are different specific device that students need to be familiar in the subjects like Digital Logic, Microprocessor, Computer Architecture, and others.

patterns: What kind of projects do students work on in the BSc. CSIT program?
What kind of project students of Bsc.CSIT works?
What project does the senior has worked on?
responses: Students in the BSc. CSIT program may work on a wide range of projects depending on their area of interest and the specific course they are taking.However, some of the projects that students has worked on e-commerce sites, recommendation system, chatbots, image detection system, medical health system, and others.

patterns: Is there a research component for the BSc. CSIT program
Are there any research opportunities available for students in the BSc. CSIT program?
responses: At padmakanya, the BSc. CSIT program offers a research component, such as the opportunity to participate in a research project or write a documentation.

patterns: What kind of support services are available for BSc. CSIT students?
Is there any support service available for students who need help beside program?
responses: Many institutions offering the BSc. CSIT program have a range of support services available for students. These may include academic advising, career services, and mental health and wellness resources.
